homes_hear_details: Kentucky's HOMES and HEAR programs are pending launch. The Kentucky Energy and Environment Cabinet is working on program design and implementation using approximately $60 million in IRA funding allocated to the state.
state_energy_office: Kentucky Energy and Environment Cabinet - Department for Energy Development and Independence

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For a family of four in Louisville, 80% AMI is approximately $58,800. Low-income households will qualify for the highest rebate levels under HOMES when the program launches.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For a family of four in Louisville, 150% AMI is approximately $110,250. Moderate-income households will qualify for partial rebates under HOMES when the program launches.

net_metering: Kentucky offers net metering for systems up to 45 kW. Under SB 100 (2019), the compensation rate for new net metering customers was changed from full retail rate to a rate set by the Public Service Commission based on the avoided cost of energy plus a solar rate adder. Existing net metering customers are grandfathered at retail rate for 25 years.

state_tax_credits.name: Kentucky does not currently offer state tax credits for residential renewable energy or energy efficiency
state_tax_credits.details: Kentucky does not have state-level solar tax credits, energy efficiency tax credits, or renewable energy tax incentives for residential customers. Residents may claim the federal 30% solar Investment Tax Credit. Kentucky does exempt solar and wind equipment from state sales tax.

state_rebate_programs.name: Kentucky Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Kentucky Housing Corporation / Community Action Kentucky
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, furnace repair and replacement, duct sealing, window and door repairs, water heater replacement
state_rebate_programs.details: Available to households at or below 200% of the federal poverty level. Administered by local community action agencies across the state.

state_rebate_programs.name: TVA EnergyRight Residential Solutions (for TVA-served areas)
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Tennessee Valley Authority and local power companies
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Heat pumps, insulation, duct sealing, ENERGY STAR windows, smart thermostats, whole-home energy assessments
state_rebate_programs.details: Available to customers in eastern Kentucky served by TVA-affiliated municipal and cooperative utilities. Includes energy audits and incentive payments for efficiency improvements.

programs.name: LG&E/KU WeCare Home Energy Assistance
programs.amount: Free energy efficiency improvements for income-qualified customers
programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, LED lighting, smart thermostats, HVAC tune-ups for qualifying low-income households

programs.name: LG&E/KU Demand Conservation Program
programs.eligible_items: Smart thermostat demand response program for central air conditioning and heat pump customers

programs.name: Duke Energy Kentucky Smart Saver Program
programs.eligible_items: ENERGY STAR heat pumps, central air conditioners, heat pump water heaters, smart thermostats

programs.name: Kentucky Power Residential Programs
programs.eligible_items: HVAC upgrades, weatherization, smart thermostats, ENERGY STAR appliances
